name:
The Plague of Athens, which hapned in the second year of the Peloponnesian Warre
First described in Greek by Thucydides; then in Latin by Lucretius. Now attempted in English
author: Sprat, Tho. (Thomas)
Hobbes, Thomas
Hobs, Thomas
Westminster, Dean of (Thomas Sprat)
Thucydides
Hobbs, Thomas
Sprat, Thomas
Θουκυδίδης
Θουκιδίδης
Rochester, Bishop of (Thomas Sprat)
Tucídides
Tucidides
body:
Poem
  Pg 4: ‘great Conqueros’ replaced by ‘great Conquerors’.
  Pg 8: ‘within ’um rage’ replaced by ‘within him rage’.
  Pg 10: ‘the toof or’ replaced by ‘the roof or’.
  Pg 11: ‘Which cur’d ’um’ replaced by ‘Which cur’d him’.
  Pg 20: ‘all min-kind’ replaced by ‘all man-kind’.
